newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks weaker in London in slow trading..
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks weaker in London in slow trading..

text.p: Hong Kong shares were weaker in London on light trading volume on Thursday.
The Hang Seng London Reference index was down 28.98 points at 11,449.79 at 1350 GMT.
In Hong Kong, the Hang Seng Index rose 42.27 points to 11,478.77.
Dealers said most interest was centered on shares in Cheung Kong, which rose after the company reported better-than-expected earnings after Hong Kong markets closed.
The company posted interest net profit of HK$8.16 billion, exceeding analysts' estimates of about HK$7.0 billion.
Cheung Kong's shares were up 1.28 at 58.025 in London.
Lower-than-expected profits of HK$7.84 billion from Hutchinson Whampoa, meanwhile, weighed on Hutchinson shares early on, dealers said.
The shares have since recovered to unchanged at 48.95.
